result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrance L Curtis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Mr. Curtis to 50 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 30 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  20 years.

The Court indicates that it wishes the Record to reflect that if the law changes in the future,  it is the Court's intention that Mr. Curtis serve every day of the confinement period

superMiscConds.notes: --to undergo a psychological or psychiatric assessment as directed by the Department of Corrections

--no direct or indirect contact with Debra Orchard

--no unsupervised contact with any child under 18 without approval of the Department of Corrections

--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession of consumption of alcohol

--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs   

--no acts or threats of violence

--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

--contact with Katie Chesson is allowed only as approved by the Department of Corrections and as agreed to by Ms. Chesson

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or therapy as directed by the Department of Corrections

--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed by treating physicians

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

-- If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: Jefferson County Sheriff's Dept
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to pay costs, fees, assessments, surcharges including the DNA surcharge

On the Defendant's 8/24/17 Motion for a New Trial:  
[MK] case called at 9:00am
Defendant Terrance L Curtis in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven W. Zaleski.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Gary Rini- sworn & testifies (by telephone) 
--direct examination by Attorney Zaleski
--cross examination by ADA Beck 
--examination by the Court 
--follow up examination by Attorney Zaleski
--follow up by examination by ADA Beck
--the Report of Gary Rini (marked as Defendant's Motion Exhibit #1) is received  

Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek- sworn & testifies (by telephone) 
-Attorney Zaleski and Mr. Curtis individually each confirm that Mr. Curtis is waiving attorney-client privilege for the purposes of Attorney Svehlek's testimony 
--direct examination by Attorney Zaleski 
--recess 10:26am, reconvene 11:00am 
--examination by the Court
--further direct examination by Attorney Zaleski
--cross examination by ADA Beck 
Evidence closed at 11:24am. 
The Court takes the Motion under advisement, noting that it has the briefs and that the Court intends to watch the two-hour video of the interview that was submitted.  The Court will strive to make its decision timely, and if not, the Court will alert counsel that the filing for an extension is needed.  
recess 11:25am.
Exhibit G to Defendant's Motion for New Trial -- Originally filed exhibit was missing page two
We will.

cc: Attorney Zaleski (electronically), JCSD - per Judge's 3/14/18 Order // by COC on 3/14/18. sf
from Atty. Zaleski requesting writ be sent directly to Sgt. Behm
Writ of habeas corpus prosequendem
It is Ordered that the Extension motion is granted. The time for the circuit court to decide the postconviction motion is hereby extended to April 20, 2018.
Copy of Motion for Enlargement of Time for Circuit Court to decide Postconviction Motion (original filed with the Court of Appeals)
Letter from the Court to Attorney Zaleski
Motion hearing on March 22, 2018 at 09:00 am.

[MA]Case called at 1:57pm
Defendant Terrance L Curtis appears via telephone from Fox Lake Correctional. His Counsel, Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appears via telephone.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court inquires of whether Defense will be presenting additional evidence/ witnesses; Atty. Zaleski indicates he will

Atty. Zaleski indicates will need a 3 hour hearing to present witnesses, including any cross examination
--Parties agree that witnesses can appear by phone, so long as exhibits are provided prior to hearing.

Atty. Zaleski is to provide ADA Beck any exhibits witnesses will be using 7 days prior to hearing; also to provide copy to the Court of day of hearing. 

Atty. Zaleski is to prepare a writ
recess: 2:05pm

NEXT: Motion Hearing on 3/22/18 at 9:00am (reserve entire morning)
Scheduling conference on January 11, 2018 at 01:45 pm.

[MA]Case called at 9:39am
Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appears via telephone  ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court consults with Atty. Zaleski on duration of motion hearing. 
The Court sets over this scheduling conference.

recess: 9:42am
NEXT: Scheduling Conference on 1/11/18 at 1:45pm (Atty. Zaleski may appear by phone and Mr. Curtis does not need to appear)

records.addlTxt: cc: DOC & DA (electronically) , Attonrey Svehlek   /tn 12-8-16
Defendant's Exhibit #1 from 12/7/16 Sentencing Hearing
Criminal Case Settlement

[MK] case called at 1:26pm. 
Defendant Terrance L Curtis in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court informs counsel that it has read the letter from Ms. Sterns and the victim impact statement of Debra Orchard.
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Beck;  the State's trial Exhibit #6 is displayed.
Sentencing argument given by Attorney Svehlek.  Defendant's Sentencing Exhibit #1 photos are displayed. 
 
The Court sentences Mr. Curtis to 50 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 30 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  20 years.   
The Court finds that Mr. Curtis is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Curtis is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 The Court gives 411 days credit for time already served.
The Court indicates that it wishes the Record to reflect that if the law changes in the future,  it is the Court's intention that Mr. Curtis serve every day of the confinement period. 

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--contact with Katie Chesson is allowed only as approved by the Department of Corrections and as agreed to by Ms. Chesson
--no direct or indirect contact with Debra Orchard
--no unsupervised contact with any child under 18 without approval of the Department of Corrections
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession of consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs   
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 
--to undergo a psychological or psychiatric assessment as directed by the Department of Corrections
--to undergo any other assessment,treatment or therapy as directed by the Department of Corrections
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed by treating physicians
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, assessments, surcharges including the DNA surcharge

Felony Firearm prohibitions/warnings given
recess 2:45pm.

DAY 5 of 5: 
[Clerk: MK.   Court Reporters:  Nancy Weaver-morning session; Katie R. Hanson-afternoon through evening sessions]
case called at 8:38am. Jury enters.
Defendant Terrance L Curtis in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek and Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Jury enters at 8:40am. In response to the Court's inquiry, the Jurors confirm that they have complied with the Court's prohibitions against discussing the case with others and against conducting their own investigation.

Det. Sgt. Donald C. Hunter- sworn & resumes testimony
--further direct examination by ADA Beck
--cross examination by Attorney Svehlek
--Juror written questions (marked as Court's Exhibits L, M, N, O) submitted; questions M, N, O asked of the witness by the Court

Debra Rebiger- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck 
--cross examination by Attorney Svehlek

Det. Daniel Horvatin- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck
--the State's Exhibit #2 Stipulation regarding the Citgo Surveillance footage is read by the Court to the Jury 
--State's Exhibit #83 disc with video is played 
--the State's Exhibit #3 Stipulation regarding the Pal Steel Surveillance footage is read by the Court to the Jury 
--State's Exhibit #84 disc with video is played 
--the State's Exhibit #5 Stipulation regarding the US Cellular phone records is read by the Court to the Jury 
--State's Exhibit #89, #88, #88A 
--the State's Exhibit #4 Stipulation regarding the Verizon phone records is read by the Court to the Jury 
--State's Exhibit #94
--recess 10:21am, reconvene 10:45am. Jury enters.
--cross examination by Attorney Svehlek
--redirect examination by ADA Beck
--recross examination by Attorney Svehlek 
--Juror written questions (marked as Court's Exhibits P,Q) asked of the witness by the Court
--follow up examination by ADA Beck  
--follow up examination by Attorney Svehlek

Det. Vaughn Johnson- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck
--State's Exhibit #85, #86, #87, #87A

Natalie Steimke- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck 
--cross examination by Attorney Svehlek
--Juror written question (marked as Court's Exhibits R) asked of the witness by the Court
State rests 11:46am.
Jury exits at 11:51am.
The Court reviews with Mr. Curtis his right to testify/not to testify.  
After Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Curtis has chosen not to testify, the Court clarifies to Mr. Curtis that he may still change his mind on this and choose to testify.
Recess 11:57am. 
Recess 1:06pm.  Jury enters.

Bruce Hein- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by Attorney De La Rosa 
--cross examination by ADA Beck
--Juror written question (marked as Court's Exhibits S) asked of the witness by the Court

Scott Laabs- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by Attorney De La Rosa
Defense rests  at 1:32pm. 
Evidence closed at 1:32pm. 
Jury exits at 1:33pm. 
Jury Instruction Conference held (1:34pm to 2:28pm) 
Jury enters at 2:31pm.  

Closing arguments given by ADA Beck (2:32pm-2:49pm)
Closing arguments given by Attorney  (2:49pm-3:06pm)
Rebuttal Closing arguments given by ADA  (3:06pm-3:08pm)
The Court instructs the Jury (3:08pm-3:24pm)
Deputy J. Seidel is sworn as the Jury Bailiff.
The alternate jurors are selected through the tumbler system; Jurors #1709 and #856 are excused from the Jury. 
The Jury retires to deliberate at 3:27pm.
After discussion and arguments from counsel, the Court provides received Exhibits #6, #11 through #40A, #42 through #58, #60 through #77, #85 through #88, #90, #93 to the Jury , through the Bailiff, for use in deliberations.  [Exhibits #1 through #5 Stipulations have been provided to the Jury as part of the Jury Instructions packet.] 

8:04pm.: the Jury returns with its Verdict.

The Jury finds Mr. Curtis guilty of First Degree Reckless Homicide as charged in the Information.
Attorney Svehlek indicates that the Defense is not asking that the Court poll the Jury. 
The Court excuses the Jury.  The Jury exits at 8:08pm. 
On Motion of the State, the Court accepts the Jury's Verdict of Guilty, finds the Defendant guilty as charged, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
The Court revokes Bond. 
recess 8:09pm. 

NEXT:   schedule the Sentencing Hearing in approximately 45 days (allow 1/2 day)--counsel may contact the Judicial Assistant early next week to coordinate the date

DAY 1 of 5: 
[Clerk: MK;    Court Reporters: Nancy Weaver- morning session; Katie R. Hanson-afternoon session] 
case called at 8:34am.
Defendant Terrance L Curtis in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek and Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck recites the Stipulation of the parties regarding the Chain of Custody related to the 911 phone call recording:  The parties would agree that the Court could find that there was a 911 call made by Katie Chesson at approximately 9:45pm on the evening of October 22, 2015; that this phone call was recorded; Dispatch sent a copy to the Sheriffs Department.  It was received by Detective-Sergeant Donald Hunter.  It was entered into evidence and maintained pursuant to protocols and standards for maintenance of evidence.  A copy of that phone call recording was subsequently provided both to the DAs Office and the Defense. And that it is a true and unedited and unaltered version of that 911 call. 
After verifying with Attorney Svehlek and with Mr. Curtis individually that they join in the agreement, the Court receives this Stipulation. 
ADA Beck informs the Court that the parties have agreed that when the recorded interview of Mr. Curtis is played, the recording can begin at 3 minutes, 11 seconds.
On agreement of counsel, the Court indicates that the Court Reporter will not need to take down the audio portions of recorded evidence during the trial. 
After Attorney De La Rosa indicates that he intends to ask jurors, during voir dire, whether they have donated or support Mr. Trump's presidential campaign, and Attorney De La Rosa provides the basis for this question that research has shown that those supporters have a more authoritarian view, the Court indicates that it will only allow questions to be asked about donations to political candidates and whether they have a political bumper sticker on their vehicle. 
Recess 8:43am, Reconvene 8:59am with potential jurors in the courtroom.

--Voir dire by the Court:  Juror #2013 excused for cause
--Voir dire by ADA Beck

--Jurors #912 and #1349 excused for cause
--Jurors re-enter the courtroom at 10:34am.

--Voir dire by Attorney De La Rosa: Jurors #1003, #1998,#1555, #1151 excused for cause

(12) Juror #164, (13) Juror #461, (14) Juror #1220.

[MK] case called at 8:39am. 
Defendant Terrance L Curtis in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel indicate there are no ongoing case negotiations at this point and that they are prepared to proceed to trial as scheduled to commence on October 17th.
The Court addresses Mr. Curtis, discussing the Court's trial scheduling and indicating to Mr. Curtis that the last opportunity to enter a change-in-plea is at noon on Tuesday, October 11th; thereafter the Court will intend that the trial proceeds.
ADA Beck indicates that the State intends to call approximately 18 witnesses; she anticipates the State's case-in-chief being in by noon on Thursday. 
Attorney Svehlek indicates that the Defense will call an additional 12 witnesses; the expert witness is traveling and he is scheduled to arrive for Thursday afternoon testimony.  
The Court will allow jurors to take written notes and to ask written questions of witnesses.
The Court will carry two additional jurors; each party will have five strikes during jury selection.
The Court instructs the clerk to bring in a larger jury panel than usual--approximately 50 jurors.  
Written stipulations, marked as trial Exhibits #1 through #5, are submitted: 
--Exhibit #1:  Stipulation and Order Regarding Chain of Custody -Rhett Chesson
--Exhibit #2:  Citgo Surveillance Video Stipulation
--Exhibit #3:  Stipulation- Pal Steel Surveillance Video 
--Exhibit #4:  Verizon Cell Phone Record Stipulation
--Exhibit #5:  Stipulation- U.S. Cellular Phone Records 
After reviewing the Stipulations with Mr. Curtis and verifying that he understand his right to require the State to prove each element of the crime and that he joins in the Stipulations, the Court receives the Stipulations finding that Mr. Curtis has freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered into them.  Trial Exhibits #1 through #5 are received. 
Counsel confirm that all filed Motions in Limine have been heard.
Attorney Svehlek orally Motions in Limine for the Court to direct that the display of the autopsy photos on the courtroom monitor-screens be removed as soon as the witness is done testifying to their content.  
After ADA Beck responds that the State is in agreement with this Motion, the Court grants the oral Motion in Limine. 
Attorney Svehlek has filed a proposed cautionary instruction regarding the autopsy photos, however she seeks an extension to file one other jury instruction by end of business today. 
The Court grants this request.  
A brief discussion is held regarding Mr. Curtis wearing street clothes during the trial. The Court directs Attorney Svehlek to verify, before the morning of trial, that clothing arrangements are in place.
recess 8:58am 

NEXT:  Jury Trial remains on the Court's calendar for October 17th through October 22nd

Continued Motion Hearing on the State's 9/2/16 Motion to Exclude Testimony of Defense Expert Witness Gary Rini and Expert Report at Trial: 
[MK] case called at 11:19am. 
Defendant Terrance L Curtis in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck acknowledges that, based on her subsequent research of case law, under Statute 971.23 (7m)(b) the Court does have the discretion not to exclude the expert when there has been a discovery violation. 
Arguments given by Attorney Svehlek, by ADA Beck
The Court will allow Mr. Rini to testify and render opinion testimony on police procedures that were followed or not followed, as set forth in his report. The Court clarifies that Mr. Rini's testimony is limited to the contents of his report. The Court will give an instruction to the Jury that this information was provided to the State late. 
However the Court excludes any testimony and opinions of Mr. Rini on the cause of death or manner of death. 
After Attorney Svehlek makes inquiries regarding the possible filing of supplemental reports related to the JESO policies and procedures that she is receiving today and then providing to Mr. Rini, the Court indiccates that this would be subject to the same duty to comply with ongoing discovery. If the State feels there is any violation of discovery related to this, the State may file a motion.
recess 12:01pm. 

NEXT:  the 10/6/16 FSSC and the 10/17-10/22/16 Jury Trial remain on the Court's calendar [and the back up dates for FSSC and Jury Trial in November should continue to remain on the calendar]
Defendant's Response to the Court's Request for Caselaw/Information
States supplemental argument to support the States Motion to Exclude Expert Witness and Expert Report Attachment to State's Letter Brief on Motion to Exclude Expert Witness
Motion hearing on September 27, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Continuation of 8/24/16 Motion Hearing:
[MK] case called at 8: 34am. 
Defendant Terrance L Curtis in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek . ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Co-Counsel, Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa, is present during portions of the hearing. 

On the dual Motions regarding third party-person evidence of a person who could have committed the offense, under Denny case law:
--Arguments given by Attorney Svehlek, Attorney De La Rosa, and ADA Beck. 
--The Court grants the Defense Motion.  The Defense will be allowed to argue and submit evidence in support of their theory that D.O. committed the crime.     

On the issue of allowing victim D.O. to be present in the courtroom during the evidentiary portion of the trial: 
--the parties agree that D.O. fits the definition under 950.02(4b) of being a person who resided in the home of the victim
--the Court orders Witness Exclusion
--after hearing arguments from Attorney Svehlek and ADA Beck, the Court concludes that it is not authorized to exclude witnesses or anyone else from the trial other than during the evidentiary portion of trial;  the Court orders that witnesses or potential witnesses are not to be present in the courtroom except when testifying and that this Order takes effect after Opening Statements are completed, and this Order expires once Evidence is closed. 
--the Court orders that witnesses and potential witnesses shall not communicate with each other commencing at 8:30 on the morning of Day 1 of Trial and ending when the Evidence is closed.  To the extent that the Courts allow victim-witnesses in the courtroom, the Order regarding not communicating with each other remains in effect.  
--the Court finds that D.O. does have the State Constitutional right to be present at the trial; the Court does not find that sequestration is necessary--the presence of D.O. will not compromise the Defendant's right to a fair trial.  

On the State's Motion to Admit Other Acts:  
--ADA Beck confirms that the State does intend to admit the Defendant's statements regarding accidents involving the child
--arguments given by ADA Beck, by Attorney Svehlek related to the prior bad act of the Texas conviction
--recess 10:34am, reconvene 10:51am.
--the Court grants the Motion contigent upon the Defense arguing or presenting testimony that the Defendant caused the child's death by accident. If the Defense puts in evidence that is suggestive of that theory, then the prior bad act of the Defendant abusing his girlfriend in Texas in 2012 comes in.  The Court will give a cautionary instruction if requested by either party.
--the Court clarifies that the Defendant will be allowed to introduce evidence that he is a seen as good parent so long as those descriptions do not include non-violence.  If the Defense introduces argument or evidence that the Defendant is a non-violent person or of non-violent character, then the State will be allowed to present this evidence.

On the State's 9/2/16 Motion to Exclude Testimony of Defense Expert Witness Gary Rini and Expert Report at Trial: 
--arguments given by Attorney Svehlek, by ADA Beck
--the Court finds that there has been a violation of the discovery order; there is prejudice to the State by this delay. The Court does not find that good cause has been shown for this violation. The Court grants the Motion to Exclude. 
--however Attorney Svehlek then argues for the Court to give consideration to Statute 971.23 (7m)(b), asserting that the Court has the discretion not to exclude the expert because of a discovery violation.
therefore State to continue to respond to the Defense expert in good faith.  
--the Court schedules a continued hearing on this issue, requiring counsel to file, by end of business on Monday [9/26/16] a letter informing the Court whether they have found any related case law, and giving any citations to legal authority.   
recess 11:38am. 

NEXT:  Motion Hearing on 9/27/16 at 11:15am

[MK] case called at 8:33am. 
Defendant Terrance L Curtis in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel indicate that they have been discussing trial arrangements, including that ADA Beck has checked on the availability of the State's expert witnesses and officer-witnesses.  In checking with these witnesses, she found that the week of October 17th is a week where all of these witnesses have no schedule conflicts. 
ADA Beck anticipates that the State will call approximately forty witnesses and that the State's case will be presented in 3 1/2 to 4 days.
Counsel agree that a trial length of one week should be scheduled.
The Court schedules the trial for the week of October 17th. The Court instructs counsel to keep the Saturday of the trial week as well.
On request of ADA Beck, the Court also schedules dates for a "back up week"  for the Jury Trial. 
The Court requires that disclosure of witnesses including expert witnesses be filed by end of business on 7/22/16. 
The Court requires that all pretrial motions be filed by end of business on 7/22/16.
The Court directs counsel to contact the JA for scheduling of a motion hearing date. 
recess 8:40am.

[MK] case called at 1:31pm. 
Defendant Terrance L Curtis appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Curtis verifies that the date of birth and address on the Criminal Complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that the Defense is requesting that a Preliminary Hearing be scheduled within an extended twenty day time limit.  However ADA Beck indicates that the State is asking for a Preliminary Hearing within the ten day time limit. 

The Court requires a $500,000 Cash Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Debra Orchard 
--no presence at the residence of Debra Orchard or at any place she may temporarily reside
--not to have any unsupervised contact with children
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin 
--no acts or threats of violence 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
recess 1:37pm. 


NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 11/5/15 at 8:30am.
